intro: Edraianthus montenegrinus, commonly known as the Montenegro bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It is a perennial species belonging to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
